roleset.name: (cause to) become narrow or sparse
roleset.note: THIN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'thin' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. Member of Vncls other_cos-45.4. (from thin.01-v)

role.descr: component parts of arg1 that aren't close together

roleset.name: have a low density, narrow width
roleset.note: THIN-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-2,3 (from thin.01-j)
THINNER-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from thinner.01-j)

role.descr: component parts of arg1 that aren't close together

example.name: both args
example.text: The small area we were in was thin of trees so I could see the sky.
example.arg: The small area we were in
so I could see the sky

example.name: arg1
example.text: -LRB- BTW , he 's very thin , but has a heart condition -RRB- .

roleset.name: thin_out: to make or become sparse or sparser
roleset.note: THIN_OUT-V NOTES: See Vncls other_cos-45.4. (from thin.02-v)

example.name: passive
example.text: For one thing , Pentagon officials worry that the U.S. will have a much tougher time persuading Europeans to keep some short-range nuclear weapons on their soil once [Soviet armored forces]-1 are thinned [*-1]out .
